en_0-1.title: Moonbeam's Ocean Friend
en_0-1.text: Moonbeam shines down, down, down. Into future ocean deep. Glowing fish swim by, by, by. Wave says 'Hello friend!' Moonbeam giggles soft and bright. 'Sleep now, ocean friend.' Together they rest, rest, rest.
en_0-1.description: A gentle moonbeam discovers friendship with sea waves in a futuristic underwater world.

scores.verdict: A soothing, dreamy bedtime story that a 0-1-year-old would likely love for its gentle rhythm and warmth.
scores.fix: Add a slightly more distinct character trait or interaction to deepen Moonbeam's personality beyond just 'glowing' and 'giggling'.

en_0-1.title: Bella's Soft Petal Bed
en_0-1.text: Bella butterfly flies, flies, flies. Pretty flowers dance, dance, dance. Which flower bed? Which flower bed? Soft rose petals, warm and red. Hush, hush, little wings. Moonbeams sing sweet lullabies. Close tiny eyes, sleep tight. Sweet dreams in flower light.
en_0-1.description: A gentle butterfly finds the perfect flower to rest in as night falls over the magical garden.

scores.verdict: A soothing, rhythmic bedtime story that a 0-1-year-old would likely love for its warmth and simplicity.
scores.fix: Add a slightly more distinct character trait or interaction for Bella to enhance memorability.

en_0-1.title: Cloudy's Island Lullaby
en_0-1.text: Cloudy floats, soft and white. Over islands in moonlight. Shh, shh, families sleep. Mama, papa, dreams so deep. Ocean waves go hush, hush, hush. Cloudy whispers, soft and plush. Sleep now, sleep now, close your eyes. Under starry island skies.
en_0-1.description: A gentle cloud drifts over peaceful island homes, bringing comfort and sweet dreams to sleeping families below.

scores.verdict: A soothing, rhythmic lullaby that a 0-1-year-old would likely love for its warmth and simplicity.
scores.fix: Introduce a slightly more distinct character trait or interaction for Cloudy to enhance memorability.

en_1-3.title: Arjun's Flying Robot Friend
en_1-3.text: Little Arjun found a robot friend, Shiny blue with lights that bend. Robot says, "Let's float and play!" Up they go, hooray, hooray! Through the sky above Mumbai, Friends together, flying high. Robot whispers, "Time to rest, Friendship is the very best." Down they float to bed so deep, Arjun smiles and falls asleep.
en_1-3.description: A brave little boy in futuristic India discovers a magical robot friend who teaches him about play and friendship through floating adventures.

scores.verdict: A 1-3-year-old would likely love this whimsical, soothing bedtime poem with a touch of adventure and warmth.
scores.fix: Add a simple, repetitive phrase (e.g., 'Up we go, up we fly!') to enhance re-listen value.

en_1-3.title: Pepper's Garden Light
en_1-3.text: Little Pepper, red and round, In the garden, safe and sound. Carrots sleepy, peas so tired, All the veggies feeling wired. Pepper thinks, "What can I do? Make them cozy, through and through." Found a firefly's gentle gleam, Soft and warm, a golden dream. Now the garden glows so bright, Everyone says, "Good night, good night." Pepper curls upon a leaf, Garden home brings sweet relief.
en_1-3.description: A gentle ladybug named Pepper helps her vegetable garden family by finding the perfect nighttime glow. A soothing poem about problem-solving and caring for home.

scores.verdict: A 1-3-year-old would likely love this cozy, rhythmic bedtime poem with a gentle glow and soothing imagery.
scores.fix: Consider adding a simple, repetitive refrain (e.g., 'Glow, glow, garden light') to enhance re-listen value.

en_1-3.title: Ava's Cozy Igloo Quest
en_1-3.text: Little Ava walks on snow so white, Looking for a bed so warm and bright. She finds an igloo, round and small, With fluffy furs upon the wall. The polar bear says, "Come inside, This cozy home is warm and wide." Ava snuggles, soft and deep, In her Arctic home to sleep.
en_1-3.description: A brave little girl searches for the perfect cozy spot in the snowy Arctic and discovers a warm igloo for sweet dreams.

scores.verdict: A soothing, cozy bedtime poem that most 1-3-year-olds would enjoy for its warmth and gentle rhythm, though it lacks a standout 'wow' moment.
scores.fix: Add a subtle interactive element (e.g., 'Can you find the fluffy furs?') to boost engagement without disrupting the sleepy tone.

en_4-5.title: Nayeli's Arctic School Discovery
en_4-5.text: Long ago in the Arctic white, Lived Nayeli, brave and bright. With her sealskin boots so warm, She walked through each snowy storm. One day while hunting for her meal, She found tracks that looked so real. Polar bear paws in the snow, Where could they possibly go? Following prints both big and small, She climbed up an icy wall. There behind the frozen peak, She found what she came to seek. A school made of crystal ice, Where animals learned so nice! Bear cubs counting fish to eat, Seals learning to swim so neat. Arctic foxes shared their food, While walruses played and wooed. Nayeli watched with wonder deep, As creatures learned before they sleep. Now when stars begin to glow, She dreams of that school of snow. Where all creatures, big and small, Learn together, one and all.
en_4-5.description: A brave Inuit girl discovers a magical ice school where polar animals gather to learn together in the snowy wilderness.

scores.verdict: A 4-5-year-old would love this enchanting Arctic adventure with its cozy, dreamy tone and relatable protagonist.
scores.fix: Add a simple refrain or repeated phrase (e.g., 'Follow the tracks, big and small') to enhance listen_again value.

en_4-5.title: Arjun's Magic Peacock Feather
en_4-5.text: Little Arjun found a feather bright, Blue and green with golden light. From Mayura, the peacock king, A gift that made his heart sing. When he waved it in the air, Flowers bloomed everywhere! Rainbow colors filled the sky, As magical birds came floating by. Through his play, the world grew new, Filled with wonder, green and blue. Arjun learned with joy so deep, Magic lives in hearts that leap. Now he dreams of feathers bright, Dancing softly through the night.
en_4-5.description: A young boy in ancient India discovers a magical peacock feather that transforms his world through play and wonder.

scores.similar_to: Kenji and the Dragon's Lost Bell
scores.verdict: A 4-5-year-old would likely adore this whimsical, soothing poem with its vibrant imagery and gentle rhythm.
scores.fix: Consider adding a simple, repetitive refrain (e.g., 'Wave the feather, watch it gleam!') to enhance re-listen value.

en_4-5.title: Aria's Floating Home Friends
en_4-5.text: In the year three thousand, on waters so blue, Lived Aria in a home that gently flew. Her floating island house bobbed on the sea, With crystal walls sparkling, wild and free. One morning she noticed a shimmer below, Where rainbow-scaled dolphins began to show. They clicked and they whistled, "Come play with us here!" Aria smiled wide, her heart full of cheer. She pressed a blue button, her floor became clear, To see all the wonders swimming so near. Glowing jellyfish danced in coral trees, While seahorse families rode ocean breeze. The dolphins taught Aria their singing song, She hummed back sweetly, gentle and strong. Together they played in the warm, sunny waves, Exploring the gardens in underwater caves. Now every day Aria looks through her floor, To wave at her friends by the coral shore. Her floating home rocks her softly to sleep, With ocean friends watching, their friendship to keep.
en_4-5.description: A brave girl named Aria discovers magical sea creatures living beneath her floating island home in the future ocean world, forming wonderful new friendships.

scores.verdict: A 4-5-year-old would adore this whimsical, soothing ocean adventure with a strong sense of wonder and friendship.
scores.fix: Add a simple, repetitive refrain (e.g., 'Under the sea, under the sky') to enhance listen_again value.

en_6-8.title: Nayak and the Forgotten Ice Garden
en_6-8.text: Deep in the Arctic, where snowflakes dance, Lived young Nayak in his family's stance, An igloo warm with seal oil light, That glowed like stars throughout the night. One morning while his parents slept, Nayak found a crack that wept, With crystal drops of purest blue, That sparkled with a magic hue. He followed down the icy trail, Through passages both narrow and frail, Until he found a garden bright, With frozen flowers, pure delight. Ice tulips bloomed in silver rows, And crystal trees where arctic wind blows, This secret world beneath their home, Where winter's children freely roam. He climbed back up with wonder true, To share this gift of arctic blue, For nature keeps her treasures near, In places that we hold most dear. Now Nayak dreams of gardens white, Beneath his family's loving light, Where magic sleeps in ice and snow, And peaceful winter breezes blow.
en_6-8.description: A young Inuit boy discovers a magical ice garden beneath his family's igloo, learning that nature's most precious treasures are often hidden in plain sight.

scores.verdict: A 6-8-year-old would likely adore this enchanting, soothing Arctic adventure with vivid imagery and gentle wonder.
scores.fix: Deepen Nayak’s emotional connection to the garden (e.g., a small interaction with a creature or a personal wish tied to it) to elevate character memorability.

en_6-8.title: Mei and the Moonlit Origami Festival
en_6-8.text: In the bamboo forest where the moon shines bright, Lived brave little Mei with paper folding might. She loved making cranes that could dance and fly, But the festival needed more beneath the sky. Her friend Hana painted with colors so true, While Kenji carved dragons from bamboo. Taro sang melodies sweet and clear, But Mei felt worried the day drawing near. "My origami won't be enough alone," She sighed as she sat by the wishing stone. But Hana heard her and had a bright thought, "Together we'll make what cannot be bought!" They painted Mei's cranes in sunset hues, Kenji carved holders in morning blues. Taro's songs made the paper dance, Giving each creature a magical chance. When festival night came with silver light, Their origami glowed warm and bright. The village gasped at the wondrous sight, Friends working together made everything right. Now Mei dreams of paper birds that soar, With friends beside her, she could ask for no more. In moonbeams soft, her origami rest, Knowing together, they always do their best.
en_6-8.description: A young girl and her forest friends work together to create magical origami creatures for the annual Moonlit Festival, learning that their different talents make the celebration truly special.

scores.similar_to: Priya and the Sacred Scroll of Learning
scores.verdict: A 6-8-year-old would love this cozy, heartwarming tale of friendship and creativity under the moonlit sky.
scores.fix: Add a subtle refrain or repeated phrase (e.g., 'fold by fold, friend by friend') to enhance listen_again value.

en_6-8.title: Zara and the Crystal Coral Symphony
en_6-8.text: In the year three thousand and more, Where floating islands kiss the shore, Lived Zara with her diving suit so bright, Exploring depths both day and night. Beneath the waves of sapphire blue, She found a world both strange and new, Where crystal corals sang in harmony, A underwater symphony. The dolphin-folk with silver scales, Shared ancient songs and wondrous tales, "Come join us, Zara, brave and true, We've waited long to meet with you." Together they would swim and play, Through coral gardens every day, The seahorse prince, the whale so wise, Showed her treasures 'neath the skies. They taught her how to hear the reef, Its songs of joy, its notes of grief, How every creature had a part, In music made from ocean's heart. When Zara's air grew thin and low, Her new friends said, "You need not go, For friendship bridges sea and land, We'll always be here, hand in hand." Now every night when stars appear, Zara listens close to hear, The crystal songs that drift above, From friends below, sent up with love.
en_6-8.description: A brave young explorer discovers magical underwater cities and forms lasting friendships with sea creatures who create music from living coral.

scores.verdict: A 6-8-year-old would likely adore this enchanting, soothing underwater adventure with memorable friends and magical moments.
scores.fix: Add a simple, recurring refrain (e.g., 'Listen close, the corals call...') to enhance rhythm and re-listen value.

en_8-12.title: Coral's Journey Through the Healing Tides
en_8-12.text: In ancient waters, deep and blue, Lived Coral, spirit brave and true. She swam through currents, swift and free, Guardian of the healing sea. But something strange began to show— The waters dimmed, their healing glow Grew weak and pale. The fish felt ill, The coral reefs grew cold and still. Then Coral dove to depths unknown, Where tiny plankton called their home. She watched them dance, so small, so bright, Creating oxygen and light. "We are the healers!" they sang sweet, "Through photosynthesis complete! We breathe in sunlight, breathe out air, For every creature, everywhere." Now Coral understood at last— The healing wisdom of the past. The smallest life creates the whole, The ocean's breath, the ocean's soul. She guards the plankton, night and day, Keeping pollution far away. For in their microscopic dance, Lies healing's greatest, sweetest chance.
en_8-12.description: A young ocean spirit discovers how the microscopic world of plankton creates life-giving oxygen, transforming her understanding of the sea's healing powers.

scores.verdict: An 8-12-year-old would love this for its lyrical science theme and brave, relatable protagonist, though it could use a touch more warmth for bedtime.
scores.fix: Add a gentle, repetitive refrain (e.g., 'Sleep now, little guardian, the sea sings soft and low') to deepen the cuddle factor.

en_8-12.title: Diego and the Star Map of the Ancient Temple
en_8-12.text: In the jungle green where temples rise, Lived Diego with his curious eyes, He loved to climb the pyramid stone, But often felt he walked alone. One starlit night he found a door, Hidden deep in temple floor, Inside, the walls began to glow, With constellations high and low. The ancient map showed Venus bright, And Jupiter's majestic light, Each planet danced in painted gold, With stories that the Maya told. As Diego traced each starry line, He saw how all the stars align, Like friends who come from far and near, To make the night sky bright and clear. He learned that just like stars above, We're connected through our love, Each friendship is a shining light, That guides us through the darkest night. Now Diego knows he's not alone, The stars and friends have always shown, That in this cosmic, vast embrace, We each have found our special place.
en_8-12.description: A young Mayan boy discovers a celestial map in an ancient temple that reveals the connection between earthly friendships and the vast cosmos above.

scores.verdict: An 8-12-year-old would likely love this poetic blend of adventure, astronomy, and emotional warmth, especially if they enjoy space or ancient cultures.
scores.fix: Add a subtle refrain or repeated phrase (e.g., 'like stars in the sky') to enhance listen_again value.

en_8-12.title: Amara and the Great Drum Celebration
en_8-12.text: In the shadow of great baobab trees so old, Lived Amara with stories painted bold, On cavern walls with ochre, red and gold, Her passion for art would never grow cold. The harvest moon was rising bright and high, The celebration drums would fill the sky, But Amara's heart let out a worried sigh— She dreamed to paint the rhythm, but didn't know why. "I'll journey far to find the perfect beat, To paint the sounds that make our lives complete!" With pigments mixed and brushes at her feet, She set out on her quest through morning's heat. Past thundering falls where waters danced and played, Through grasslands where the zebras grazed and stayed, She listened close to every sound that swayed, The rhythm of the earth that nature made. The elephants stomped out a steady thrum, The birds sang melodies to morning's sun, But still she felt her quest was not yet done, The celebration rhythm hadn't come. As evening stars began to softly gleam, She sat beside a gently flowing stream, And heard her heartbeat like a distant dream— The rhythm she'd been seeking, pure and clean. She rushed back home with colors bright and true, And painted drums in every brilliant hue, The celebration started, voices grew, Her heart-rhythm painting made the music new. Now when the harvest moon shines overhead, And all the village children go to bed, They dream of Amara's journey widespread, Where art and music beautifully wed.
en_8-12.description: A young cave painter embarks on a quest to find the perfect rhythm for her tribe's harvest celebration in prehistoric Africa. Through her journey across ancient landscapes, she discovers that the most beautiful music comes from the heart.

scores.verdict: An 8-12-year-old would likely love this poetic adventure for its vivid imagery and heartfelt journey, though it could use a touch more interactive rhythm to fully captivate.
scores.fix: Add a simple, repeatable rhythmic refrain (e.g., 'Thrum-thrum went the earth, beat-beat went her heart') to enhance re-listen value and engagement.

en_12+.title: The Forest's Digital Symphony
en_12+.text: In the heart of the Pacific Northwest, Where cedars touch the clouded sky, Live creatures with a modern quest— To blend old wisdom with WiFi. Luna the fox codes by moonlight, While Sage the owl debugs her dreams, And River the raccoon streams midnight Nature documentaries by streams. Together they seek the Digital Grove, Where legend says the ancients planned A place where circuits learn to love The rhythm of the living land. Through fern-filled paths and mossy stones, They follow signals in the breeze, Until they find where nature owns The harmony of code and trees. Here algorithms dance with rain, And servers hum like cricket songs, Proof that progress need not stain The world where every heart belongs. So rest now, knowing dreams can weave Technology with nature's art, And every passion we believe Can honor both the mind and heart.
en_12+.description: A young fox and her woodland friends discover an ancient grove where nature and technology harmonize, teaching them that modern passions can coexist beautifully with the natural world.

scores.verdict: A 12+-year-old would likely love this for its fresh blend of nature and technology, sparking curiosity and comfort.
scores.fix: Tighten the rhythm in the third stanza to enhance flow and memorability.

en_12+.title: Amara and the Star-Song Celebration
en_12+.text: In the cradle of humanity's dawn, Where acacia trees stretched toward the sky, Lived Amara, whose eyes were drawn To the ancient stars wheeling by. Her grandmother spoke of stellar lore, How constellations told the seasons' tale, But Amara saw patterns no one saw before— Celestial rhythms that never fail. She traced the paths of wandering lights, Those planets dancing their orbital song, Calculating distances through countless nights, Wondering where in this dance she belonged. The elders gathered when she shared her sight, How Venus rises before the dawn, How Jupiter's moons eclipse its light, How stellar wisdom can guide us on. "You are the keeper of cosmic truth," Her grandmother smiled with ancient grace, "Your gift connects our people's youth To the infinite wisdom of time and space." The tribe prepared a celebration grand, With drums that echoed the pulsar's beat, And Amara, with her steady hand, Made star-maps where science and spirit meet. As firelight danced beneath the dome Of countless suns in velvet night, Amara knew she'd found her home— A bridge between earth's warmth and stellar light. Now when you gaze at stars above, Remember Amara's gift so true: That science blooms from wonder's love, And the cosmos celebrates in you.
en_12+.description: A young prehistoric astronomer in ancient Africa discovers her unique gift for reading celestial patterns and leads her tribe in a celebration of the cosmos.

scores.verdict: A 12+-year-old would likely love this poetic blend of science, culture, and wonder, making it a standout bedtime read.
scores.fix: Consider adding a subtle refrain or repeated phrase to enhance the 'listen_again' score slightly.

en_12+.title: Siku and the Ancient Ice Compass
en_12+.text: In the Arctic's silver embrace, where ancestors walked with grace, Lived Siku, bold and bright, beneath the dancing northern light. Her grandmother's tales would flow of magic in the ice and snow, Of compasses carved from ancient stone, that never left a soul alone. One dawn when frost adorned her breath, she ventured past the village rest, To hunting grounds her fathers knew, where ice ran deep and crystal blue. Beneath a ridge of glacial might, she glimpsed a soft ethereal light, A compass made of ice so pure, its magic ancient and secure. The needle spun with starlight gleams, revealing more than what it seems, Not north or south, but bonds of heart, connections that would never part. It showed her friend across the bay, though storms had kept her friend away, Their friendship strong through winter's test, their spirits joined from east to west. She learned the compass held the truth that friendship is eternal youth, Through seasons harsh and distances wide, true friends remain close by your side. The ancient magic in the ice reflected bonds that never splice, A discovery profound and deep, that warmed her heart and soul to keep. Now when the Arctic winds blow strong, and winter nights seem far too long, Siku holds her compass near, and feels her friendship crystal clear. The magic lives in hearts that care, in bonds that time can never wear.
en_12+.description: A young Inuit girl discovers a mystical ice compass that reveals the true meaning of friendship through ancient Arctic magic.

scores.verdict: A 12+-year-old would likely love this for its evocative Arctic fantasy and heartfelt theme, though it could benefit from slightly more rhythmic repetition.
scores.fix: Add a refrain or repeated phrase (e.g., 'the compass spins with starlight gleams') to enhance listen_again value.

hi_0-1.title: Nanha Sitara Aur Uski Neend Ki Lori
hi_0-1.text: Nanha sitara chamka. Shh shh, neend aa rahi. Jungle sota, sitara jagta. Komal roshni, komal roshni. Patte hilte, hawa chalti. Shh shh, neend aa gayi. Sitara muskaya, sab so gaye.
hi_0-1.description: Ek chhota sitara jungle mein sabko neend dilata hai apni komal roshni se.

scores.verdict: A soothing, rhythmic lullaby-like story that a 0-1-year-old would likely find comforting and sleep-inducing.
scores.fix: Introduce a named character or a simple, repetitive action (e.g., 'Nanha Sitara ne patti ko chua') to enhance memorability and engagement.

hi_0-1.title: Nano Khargosh Aur Samudri Dost
hi_0-1.text: Nano khargosh. Neela paani. Shh shh shh. Machli dost. Haan haan haan. Saath mein khel. Chup chup chup. Garam ret. So jao so jao. Meethe sapne.
hi_0-1.description: Ek chhota khargosh aur uska naya samudri dost saath mein sote hain.

scores.verdict: A soothing, rhythmic bedtime story that a 0-1-year-old would enjoy for its gentle sounds and warmth, though it lacks strong character engagement.
scores.fix: Add a simple, repetitive character action (e.g., 'Nano khargosh ne machli ko bulaya') to deepen relatability and memorability.

hi_0-1.title: Chhota Ullu Aur Uske Cyber Dost
hi_0-1.text: Chhota ullu. Lambe ped mein. Hoo hoo hoo. Neend chahiye. Cyber dost aaye. Chamakti roshni. Saath saath. Hoo hoo hoo. Taaron ki baarish. Soft blanket. Shh shh shh. Aankhein band. Meethe sapne. Hoo hoo hoo.
hi_0-1.description: Ek nanhe ullu ka safar jo apne naye cyber doston ke saath neend ki talaash mein nikalta hai.

scores.similar_to: Nanha Sitara Aur Uski Neend Ki Lori
scores.verdict: A soothing, rhythmic bedtime story that a 0-1-year-old would enjoy for its warmth and simplicity, though it lacks depth in character and wonder.
scores.fix: Add a tiny bit more character interaction or a subtle magical twist (e.g., 'Cyber dost ne taaron ko jhulaaya') to elevate the wonder.

hi_1-3.title: Asha Ki Barf Mein Soft Bistar Ki Talash
hi_1-3.text: Asha ek brave ladki thi, barf mein rehti thi Polar bear dost ke saath, soft bistar dhundti thi Barf par chalte gaye, fluffy snow mein Mil gaya cozy jagah, warm aur clean Asha aur bear so gaye, soft barf ke bistar mein Sapno mein udti rahi, Arctic ke sitaron mein
hi_1-3.description: Ek brave ladki Asha Arctic mein apne polar bear dost ke saath sabse soft bistar dhundne ka journey karti hai.

scores.verdict: A 1-3-year-old would likely love this cozy, imaginative Arctic bedtime tale for its warmth and gentle rhythm.
scores.fix: Add slight repetition (e.g., 'soft bistar dhundti thi' refrain) to enhance listen_again value.

hi_1-3.title: Kira Ka Samudri Ghar Ki Khoj
hi_1-3.text: Kira chhoti brave girl thi, island pe rehti thi Family ke saath warm ghar mein, khushi se has rahi thi Mama Papa ke saath, naya room dhundha usne Bamboo walls aur soft mats, dekha ocean view se Grandma ne kaha 'dekho beta', shells aur pearls yahan Family ka purana treasure, mil gaya hai ghar mein Waves ki awaaz sun kar, Kira tired ho gayi Soft mat pe lie down karke, family ke paas so gayi Ocean breeze se lullaby, stars shining bright Family ka love aur warmth, good night sweet night
hi_1-3.description: Ek brave chhoti ladki Kira apne island ghar mein family ke saath naye kamre discover karti hai aur cozy sleeping jagah paati hai.

scores.similar_to: Asha Ki Barf Mein Soft Bistar Ki Talash
scores.verdict: A cozy, soothing bedtime poem that 1-3-year-olds would likely enjoy for its warmth and familial love, though it lacks standout magical elements.
scores.fix: Add a subtle fantastical touch (e.g., Kira dreaming of the ocean singing or shells glowing) to elevate the 'magic' score.

hi_1-3.title: Zara Robot Ka Naya Space Dost
hi_1-3.text: Zara hai ek brave girl, space city mein rehti hai Robot dost hai uska, saath mein khelte hain Naye khel dhundte hain, stars ke paas jaate hain Dost ban gaye hain wo, pyaar se hasate hain
hi_1-3.description: Ek brave ladki Zara apne robot dost ke saath future India mein naye khel discover karti hai.

scores.similar_to: Tinker Robot Ka Ghar Ka Khilona Dhundna
scores.verdict: A 1-3-year-old would enjoy this simple, rhythmic space adventure with a friendly robot, but it lacks deeper warmth or standout wonder.
scores.fix: Add a cozy closing line (e.g., 'Ab Zara aur robot so jaate hain, taaron ke neeche sone ko') to enhance cuddle factor.

hi_4-5.title: Naina Ki Baraf Waley School Mein Seal Dost Ki Khoj
hi_4-5.text: Baraf ke ghar mein ek din, Naina pahunchi school Jahan seal machliyan padhti, barf ka yeh rule Suno suno kehti seal, hum sikhayenge tumhe Baraf par kaise khelna, paani mein kaise rehna Naina ne sikha diving, seal ke saath khela Arctic ke jaadui raaz, sabne mil kar dekha Dost ban gaye sab milkar, baraf mein haskar Naina ki khushi dekho, seekh gayi nayi kala Ab Naina sapno mein jaaye, seal dost ke saath Baraf waley school ki yaadein, leke jaaye saath
hi_4-5.description: Brave Naina discovers a magical Arctic school where she learns from friendly seals and makes wonderful new friends.

scores.verdict: A 4-5-year-old would enjoy this whimsical Arctic adventure with its playful learning theme, though it could be more cozy for bedtime.
scores.fix: Add more soothing repetition or a softer closing line to enhance the cuddle factor for bedtime.

hi_4-5.title: Vaanar Mitra Ka Jaadui Khel Samrajya
hi_4-5.text: Ek chhota vaanar tha, Hannu naam ka pyaara Ek jaadui van mein khelta, sapno ka nazaara Jhoolon par naachta, rang badal jaate the Har khel mein kuch naya, sapne sach ho jaate the Patthar chhoote to titli, paani mein taarey Hannu ka dil khushi se, bhar gaya sitarey Khel khel mein seekha, duniya ki yeh baat Har cheez mein chhupa hai, kuch jaadui raat
hi_4-5.description: Ek chhote vaanar ka ek magical playground mein transformation ka safar, jahaan woh seekhta hai ki khel mein discovery ki shakti hai.

scores.similar_to: Meera Ki Jaadui Bamboo Forest Mein Dosti Ka Safar
scores.verdict: A 4-5-year-old would likely adore this whimsical, soothing poem with its vivid imagery and gentle rhythm.
scores.fix: Add a simple, recurring refrain (e.g., 'Hannu ka jaadu, dekho dekho!') to enhance memorability and re-listen value.

hi_4-5.title: Tino Aur Maya Ka Chandni Mein Dosti Ka Safar
hi_4-5.text: Tino rabbit aur Maya deer, best friends the wo dear. Chandni raat mein nikle, sapno ka raaja dekhne. Sitaron ke neeche chale, haath mein haath pakad ke. Magic forest mein gaye, dosti ka tohfa dhundne. Fireflies ne raah dikhayi, golden flowers mile saath. Dono ne dekha ek saath, friendship ka jaadui ghar. Ghar wapas aaye khushi se, warm blankets mein so gaye. Dosti ka sapna dekha, pyaar se neend aa gayi.
hi_4-5.description: Do chhote animals ki friendship ki kahani jo moonlight mein ek magical quest par jaate hain.

scores.similar_to: Meera Ki Jaadui Bamboo Forest Mein Dosti Ka Safar
scores.verdict: A cozy, dreamy bedtime poem that most 4-5-year-olds would enjoy for its warmth and gentle adventure.
scores.fix: Add a simple, repetitive refrain (e.g., 'Chandni raat, dosti ka saath') to enhance rhythm and re-listen value.

hi_6-8.title: Kiran Aur Samudar Ke Upar Ke Floating Islands Ki Dosti
hi_6-8.text: Samudar ke upar, aasman mein high, Tairte hue islands, crystals ki light. Kiran naam ka ladka, brave aur sweet, Robot dost Sparky ke saath, adventures complete. Floating gardens mein flowers glow karte, Holographic butterflies dance karte. Kiran lonely feel karta tha sometimes, Naye friends ki search mein, climbing heights. Ek din milе Luna, mermaid so kind, Aur Zephyr wind-sprite, pure of mind. Together they explored crystal caves deep, Sharing stories, promises to keep. Floating bridges of light unhe connect karte, Different islands, hearts ko reflect karte. Kiran ne sikha, friendship ka magic true, Distance doesn't matter, when hearts are blue. Starfish lanterns light up the night, Friends gather 'round, everything's right. Samudar ki waves, gentle lullaby sing, Dosti ki warmth, peaceful dreams bring. Now Kiran sleeps on his island home, No more alone, no need to roam. Sapno mein friends, always near, Future's bright, nothing to fear.
hi_6-8.description: Bhavishya mein samudar ke upar tairte hue magical islands par rehne wala ek brave ladka Kiran apne robot dost ke saath naye friends banata hai.

scores.similar_to: Kai aur Uske Doston ki Jaadui Yatra
scores.verdict: A 6-8-year-old would love this whimsical, heartwarming tale of friendship and floating islands, perfect for bedtime.
scores.fix: Add more rhythmic repetition or a simple refrain to enhance listen_again value.

hi_6-8.title: Priya Aur Vidya Devi Ki Jaadui Shiksha Yatra
hi_6-8.text: Priya ek chhoti si bachhi thi, brave aur smart Vidya Devi ke gurukul mein, seekhne gai art Pahadon ke beech mein tha ye jaadui school Yahan har bachha banta tha gyan ka jewel Devi ne kaha, "Beta, tumhare andar hai light Sabko sikhao, karo sab kuch right" Priya ne sikhayi dusron ko math aur song Sabke saath milkar, bani friendship strong Ab wo teacher ban gayi, kind aur wise Sapno mein bhi sikhati, under starry skies
hi_6-8.description: Ek brave bachhi Priya ek mythological gurukul mein jaadui gyan seekhti hai aur apne andar ki shakti discover karti hai.

scores.similar_to: Kai aur Uske Doston ki Jaadui Yatra
scores.verdict: A warm and comforting bedtime poem with relatable characters, but could use more rhythmic repetition to enhance re-listen value.
scores.fix: Add a simple, catchy refrain or repeated phrase to strengthen rhythm and memorability.

hi_6-8.title: Zara Aur Amazon Ke Jaadui Pranion Ka Swasthya Yatra
hi_6-8.text: Amazon ke gehre jungle mein, Zara naam ki ek ladki thi Hara bhara ped paudhon mein, uski dosti janvaron se thi Macaw parrot aur monkey friends, unhe bola "Chalo chalein" "Swasthya ka magical spring dhundein, saath mein hum chalein" Zara ne kaha "Haan bilkul, yoga aur exercise karenge" "Fruits aur nuts khaayenge, swasth hone ka raaz sikhenge" Jungle ke crystal clear stream mein, sabne paani piya Deep breathing aur meditation se, mann ko shaant kiya Sooraj dhalne laga tha, stars nikalne lage Zara aur friends ne sikha, wellness ke naye raag Ab sab so jaate hain, sapnon mein khush rahenge Swasthya aur dosti ke saath, hamesha muskurahenge
hi_6-8.description: Ek brave ladki Zara Amazon jungle mein apne animal friends ke saath swasthya aur wellness ki magical journey krti hai.

scores.similar_to: Priya Aur Vidya Devi Ki Jaadui Shiksha Yatra
scores.verdict: A soothing and health-focused bedtime poem that 6-8-year-olds would enjoy, though it lacks standout magical moments.
scores.fix: Add a whimsical or fantastical element (e.g., talking plants, glowing springs) to elevate the 'magic' score.

hi_8-12.title: Samudra ki Chhupi Duniya
hi_8-12.text: Ek bahadur bachcha tha, jiska naam Aarav tha, jo samudra ki kinare rehta tha. Wahaan par usne paani ke neeche ki duniya ko dekha, jahaan machhliyaan aur anya jeev rehte the. Usne dekha ki kaise paani ki gati aur dheere-dheere badalne wali gati samudra ki lahron ko banati hai, aur kaise yeh sab kuch ek dusre se juda hua hai.
hi_8-12.description: Ek bahadur bachche ki kahani jo samudra ki gahrayi mein jaati hai aur wahaan ke jaadui jeevan ko dekhti hai

scores.verdict: A scientifically grounded but somewhat dry bedtime poem that an 8-12-year-old might appreciate for its ocean theme, though it lacks emotional warmth or excitement.
scores.fix: Add rhythmic repetition, sensory details (e.g., sounds of waves, colors of fish), and a touch of wonder or adventure to elevate engagement.

hi_8-12.title: Advait aur Uske Doston ki Bhavishya Yatra
hi_8-12.text: Advait ek chhote se ladakh monastery mein rehta tha, jaha usne apne doston ke saath mil kar kai nayi cheezein seekhi. Ek din, unke shikshak ne unhein ek nayi yatra ke liye taiyaar kia, jaha ve bhavishya ke baare mein seekhne jaane wale the. Advait aur uske doston ne apne bag pack kiye aur yatra ke liye taiyaar ho gaye. Ve ek bhavishya shahar mein pahunche, jaha unhe kai aisi cheezein mili jo ve pehle kabhi nahin dekhe the. Unhone ek robots ke saath milkar ek maze mein se guzarna seekha, jaha unhe apne lakshyon ko praapt karne ke liye kai chunautiyon ka saamna karna pada. Phir ve ek bhavishya ke park mein gaye, jaha unhe kai aisi cheezein mili jo us samay nahin thi. Advait aur uske doston ne ek saath khelte hue aur hashte hue kai pal bitaaye. Lekin phir, unhe ek samasya ka saamna karna pada, jaha unhe apne doston ke saath milkar ek samadhan nikalna tha. Aur tabhi, advait ne apne doston ke saath milkar ek aisa samadhan nikala jo unhe sabko khushi dila sakta tha. Ab advait aur uske doston ko apni yatra ke baare mein sochkar neend aa rahi thi, aur ve apne agle din ki yatra ke liye taiyaar ho rahe the.
hi_8-12.description: Ek 10 varsh ka ladka advait apne doston ke saath ek bhavishya yatra par jata hai, jaha unhe nayi cheezein seekhne aur apne doston ke saath masti karne ka mauka milta hai. Is yatra mein ve apne aaspas ke sansar ko samajhne aur apne lakshyon ko praapt karne ke liye kai chunautiyon ka saamna karte hain.

scores.verdict: An 8-12-year-old might enjoy the futuristic adventure, but the story lacks depth and emotional warmth to fully captivate them.
scores.fix: Develop Advait and his friends' personalities and emotions more vividly, and add a stronger sense of wonder or stakes to the futuristic elements.

hi_8-12.title: Sakhiyon ki Yatra
hi_8-12.text: Ek chhota sa shehar tha, jahan ek brave bachchi rehti thi, jiska naam Sofia tha. Sofia ke paas ek sapna tha, jo usey Europe ke ek sundar shehar mein le gaya, jahan usey nayi sakhiyan mili, jinke saath usey apne sapne poore karne ke liye ek saath aana tha. Unhone ek saath yatra ki, jismein unhone apne sapnon ko poora kiya, aur ek dusre ke saath apni dosti ko mazboot kiya.
hi_8-12.description: Ek nayi dosti ki kahani, jismein sakhiyon ka saath aur sapne poore hone ki yatra hai. Yeh kahani Europe mein sthit hai, jahan sakhiyan apne sapnon ko poora karne ke liye ek saath aati hain.

scores.similar_to: Advait aur Uske Doston ki Bhavishya Yatra
scores.verdict: A child might find it pleasant but forgettable—lacks depth to captivate an 8-12-year-old.
scores.fix: Add sensory details (e.g., sights/sounds of Europe), a small conflict, or rhythmic repetition to elevate engagement.

hi_12+.title: Dosti ki Kahani
hi_12+.text: Ek chhota sa shehar tha, jiska naam Aethoria tha, jahan par logon ke dil mein pyaar aur dosti bhar gayi thi. Yahan par Nova, ek 15 saal ka non-binary teen, apne doston ke saath milkar ek anokha safar par nikal padta hai. Unka pehla mission tha, ek purani mandir ki talash, jahan par ek pracheen khazana chhupa hua tha. Nova ke saath the uske dost, Zara, Arjun, aur Lila, jo apne-apne khaas hunar ke saath aaye the. Saath milkar, ve sabhi ne mushkil raaston par chal kar mandir tak pahunchne ki koshish ki. Lekin, jab ve andar ghuste hain, to unhe ek anokhi chunauti ka samna karna padta hai. Unhe ek pracheen puzzle ko suljhana hota hai, jo keval tabhi suljhega jab ve apne hunar ko ek saath mila kar istemal karenge. Nova aur uske dost sabhi ne milkar kaam kiya, aur puzzle ko suljhaya. Ab, ve sabhi ghar waapas aane ke liye taiyaar hain, aur ek naye din ki shuruaat ke liye utsuk hain.
hi_12+.description: Ek fantasy realm mein, Nova aur uske doston ne milkar ek mushkil ko hal kiya aur dosti ki sachchai samjhe. Ye kahani dosti, teamwork, aur samajh ki mahatta ko darshati hai.

scores.verdict: A 12+-year-old might enjoy the adventure and teamwork, but it lacks depth to fully captivate them.
scores.fix: Add more emotional stakes, vivid descriptions, or a twist to heighten the 'wow' factor and warmth.

hi_12+.title: Riya ki Prakriti Yatra
hi_12+.text: Riya ek chhote se jungle mein gayi, jahaan pedon ke neeche ek sundar taal tha. Usne dekha ki taal ke kinare par kayi janwar the, jo paani peene aaye the. Riya ne socha ki prakriti kitni sundar hai, aur humein uski raksha karni chahiye. Usne apne aap se vaada kiya ki woh hamesha prakriti ki raksha karegi. Ab Riya sone ja rahi hai, aur woh chahti hai ki tum bhi prakriti ki raksha karo.
hi_12+.description: Riya, a brave child, embarks on a quest journey to appreciate nature and understand environmental awareness in the Americas, specifically in the contemporary world of North America.

scores.verdict: A 12+-year-old might find this pleasant but not gripping—it lacks depth and excitement for the age group.
scores.fix: Add a subtle adventure or conflict (e.g., Riya noticing pollution and taking action) to elevate engagement and memorability.

hi_12+.title: Ryu ki Jaadui Yatra
hi_12+.text: Ryu ek 15 saal ka samurai tha jo apne career purpose ki talaash mein tha. Vah ek din ek purane granth se milta hai jismein ek jaadui duniya ke baare mein likha tha. Vah us duniya mein jaane ke liye ek quest par nikalta hai. Vah ek jaadui van se guzarta hai jahan vah ek jaadui pakshi se milta hai. Vah pakshi use ek jaadui shehar le jaata hai jahan vah apne sapnon ko poora karne ke liye ek mauka paata hai. Ryu ne mahsoos kiya ki vah apne career purpose ko paane ke liye ek naya raasta dhoondh raha hai. Lekin vah jaanta tha ki yeh raasta aasan nahi hoga. Vah apne aap se kehta hai ki vah kabhi haar nahi maanega. Ab Ryu apne sapnon mein jaadui duniya ki yatra kar raha hai, ek naye din ki shuruaat ke liye taiyaar.
hi_12+.description: Ryu, ek 15 saal ka samurai, apne career purpose ki talaash mein nikalta hai aur ek jaadui duniya se milta hai. Yeh kahani fantasy, adventure aur self-discovery ki hai.

scores.verdict: A 12+-year-old might find this story intriguing but not deeply engaging or memorable.
scores.fix: Deepen character development and add more vivid, immersive descriptions of the magical world to enhance wonder and emotional connection.
